results.title: The Battlers
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie, Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Kylie Tennant this made for television mini-series is set in Australia during the Great Depression. It focuses on the friendship between two ‘battlers’, Dancy, an orphan who has spent most of her life on the streets and Snow, a taciturn man on the rebound from a failed marriage. Forced to travel the country in search of work, like many working-class Australians of the time, and surviving mainly on dole book rations, their lives are full of hardship and deprivation, but the comradeship they develop on the road also brings them many moments of comfort and happiness. Cast includes Audine Lieth, Marcus Graham, Anne Phelan, Gary Sweet and Jacqueline McKenzie.

results.title: The Battle of Wangapore
results.brief_description: In this satirical animation British troops under a typical Colonel Blimp test the turbanned and rebellious riff-raff from over the border and all with a stiff sense of propriety. The story tracks back to the good old days on the North West Frontier of India. An example of animation technique as used by an amateur production group. Animation by Richard Horn and Ken Clark. (See also Title Code 006110 “Let battle begin” for the history of the making of the cartoon.)

results.title: The Battle of San Pietro
results.creator_credit: John Huston and United States. Army Pictorial Service
results.brief_description: Presents modern warfare from the soldier’s point of view. Stresses the number of men killed in taking one military objective. Shows how in the Allies Italian campaign, the people of San Pietro were too stunned to realise they had been liberated.

results.title: The Battle of Huangqiao = Huang Qiao Jue Zhan
results.creator_credit: Yang Zhaoren and August First Film Studio
results.brief_description:
This film depicts the battle of Huangqiao (or: Huang Bridge) between the Chinese Communist Party and the KMT during the anti-Japanese war. In 1940, the New Route 4 Army decided to set up an anti-Japanese base in the Subei area (Jiangsu province), but the KMT sent troops 10 times more than the New Route 4 Army in order to eliminate it. The first confrontation was in Taizhou, where two chief KMT commanders in Taizhou were persuaded by CCP’s well-known general Chen Yi to join the anti-Japanese force. Chen Yi later attacked another troop of KMT and caught its leader Lin Taiyuan alive. However, Chen Yi released Lin and persuaded him again. The vice general commander of the Sulu area, Han Deqin did not want to give up and decided to have a battle with Chen’s troops at Huang Bridge. Led by Chen Yi and Su Yu, the New Route 4 Army defeated the KMT troops ten times of its size. The battle eliminated the KMT hardliners’ hope to destroy the anti-Japanese alliance between CCP and KMT, and was crucial for the foundation of the Subei anti-Japanese base.

Huangqiao battle is a key battle for the New Route 4 Army of the CCP in the early stage of the anti-Japanese war. Recently, it has attracted a renewed interest from the August First Film Studio to make a documentary film about the battle. This documentary project is supported by the State Administration of Radio, Film and Television, and it will be produced digitally. This kind of military films are normally state-sponsored and made for the purpose of patriotic education in China. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Battle of Coral
results.creator_credit: Tony Stewart, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Instinct kicked in when Private Tony Stewart and his fellow soldiers were engaged in the Battle for Coral, in Vietnam, 1968. It was the most horrific battle he would take part in but this is what Stewart was trained for and he know he had his mates there to look after him.

results.title: The Battle of Billy's pond (Captioned)
results.brief_description: When enthusiastic young fisherman, Billy, and his friend, Cobby, find their favourite pond polluted with dead fish floating on the surface, they decide to investigate. The boys discover that the pond has been poisoned by industrial waste. Based on the book by Howard Thompson.

results.title: The Battle of Algiers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Gillo Pontecorvo, Saadi Yacef and Antonio Musu
results.brief_description: Pontecorvo’s passionate and devastating study of terrorism builds a tight narrative around the reconstruction of the main political events in Algiers between 1954-57: the rise of the nationalist movement led by the Algerian Liberation Front (F. L. N.), its crushing defeat by the French in 1957 and the resurgence 3 years later of Arab nationalism with led to Algerian independence in 1962. The film holds both a specific and a universal interest; first in the observation of the method of starting - and crushing a revolutionary movement and second in the wider implications behind both French and Algerian tactics and the implicit debate on the legtimacy of the steps taken to achieve an end. In French and Arabic with English sub-titles.

results.title: The Battle for Bowen Hills
results.creator_credit: Garry Lane, Peter Gray and Crowsfoot Films
results.brief_description: The story of Brisbane working class residents’ protracted struggle to defend their homes against the inner city freeway proposals of the Queensland Government. This film was made for community groups under a similar threat and for those interested in multinational development and the political economy of transport. Narrated by Geraldine Willisee. (Also includes ex-Queensland Senator Russ Hinze).

results.title: The Battle at Elderbush Gulch
results.brief_description: Melodrama of warfare between pioneers and Indians. Silent film with musical soundtrack and English intertitles. Cast includes Lillian gish, Robert Harron, Mae Marsh, Lionel Barrymore.
